content.description:
A moderate thin crack at the start leads onto the upper face where two bolts protect somewhat delicate smears to the summit. Gear belay and walk off, or rap from the anchor atop Slim Pickings.

Fun climbing, easy access and a warm location make this a good choice on thiose cooler days.
content.location: Located on the south face of Cap Rock, almost directly above the parking lot, this route follows the prominent left crack to the face above.

climbs.name: Terminator, The
climbs.fa: Herb Laeger and Jan McCollum, November 1984

content.description: A long stem move (harder for short climbers) gets you up to the first bolt.  From there, a long, runout, exposed traverse takes you right and eventually up to the top.  This can be a scary route for the person seconding.  It gets sun most of the day.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus gear for an anchor on top
content.location: This route starts at the same place as Robocop, but branches right from the first bolt.

content.description: This route climbs the edge of the short corner to the right of "Slim Pickins", and face above.

Slabs on the South side of Cap Rock, behind the second picnic table. The thin face between two cracks (Visual Nightmare and Slim Pickings).

Thin edging leads to the first bolt and relief. More edging to the next bolt proves to be the crux. Traverse right (cam on extended sling) along the horizontal crack. The face above has sightly better holds than below, although interest is maintained to the anchor.

Rappel off the anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts, 1 medium cam, long slings, 2 bolt anchor.

content.description:
The right-hand crack.

A strenuous move starts the crack, which then relents. Up to the horizontal crack and the last of the gear protection.

A new concept begins; a tricky move begins the thin edging past 2 bolts to the crux, and, relenting slightly past one more bolt to the chain anchors.

Rappel off the anchor.
content.protection: Small/medium cams, 3 bolts to a bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Robocop
climbs.fa: Jeff Rhoads and Kate Ridgeway, April 1988

content.description: Low 5th class slab moves lead to a chimney. From top of the chimney, there is a technical face that leads to slab with four bolts. Two-bolt anchor. Decent is a short rappel off the back-side and then a wandery but easy walk-off.
content.protection:
4 bolts, medium-sized cams, 2 bolt anchor

A BD #5 protects the chimney.
content.location: To the right of Slim Pickings, the initial part of the wall becomes less steep.  Right of a crack system, you can see bolts on the upper part of the wall.  Start below the left set of bolts.

climbs.name: Nose to the Grindstone
climbs.fa: (TR) Mark and Shirley Spencer, 1986; First Lead: Dave Evans, Todd Gordon & Fred Ziel, January 1988

content.description:
This is the thin crack to the right of Slimmer Pickings. Start up an easy juggy crack to blocks. Once on the block you'll be at the start of the thin crack. Climb the thin crack to the top using locks and edges.

I did not lead this route but it climbs very well and was quite fun! Lead would be Bold, but it does seem to take thin gear. Miramontes gives this route a R rating

You can TR this route from the Slim pickings anchor, make a low 5th class traverse to the top of the thin crack, set a directional and have some fun!
content.protection: Thin rack, view Bob's comment about the fixed pins.
content.location: To the right of slimmer pickings, maybe 20 yards?

climbs.name: Eat Berthas Muscles
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Al Bartlett, Laurel Collella

content.description: This is the face with two bolts just left of Visual Nightmare.
content.protection: Qds for the two bolts, and some small to med gear for a crack section.
content.location: On the South Face of Cap Rock, left side.
